alternatePathHints.description: Potential intermediate components of a feasible path. Described below.

arn.description: ARN of the Network Insights Analysis.

explanations.description: Explanation codes for an unreachable path. See the [AWS documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_Explanation.html) for details.

filterInArns.description: A list of ARNs for resources the path must traverse.

forwardPathComponents.description: The components in the path from source to destination. See the [AWS documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_PathComponent.html) for details.

networkInsightsPathId.description:
ID of the Network Insights Path to run an analysis on.

The following arguments are optional:

pathFound.description: Set to `true` if the destination was reachable.

returnPathComponents.description: The components in the path from destination to source. See the [AWS documentation](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/API_PathComponent.html) for details.

startDate.description: The date/time the analysis was started.

status.description: The status of the analysis. `succeeded` means the analysis was completed, not that a path was found, for that see `path_found`.

statusMessage.description: A message to provide more context when the `status` is `failed`.

tags.description: Map of tags to assign to the resource. If configured with a provider `default_tags` configuration block present, tags with matching keys will overwrite those defined at the provider-level.

tagsAll.description: Map of tags assigned to the resource, including those inherited from the provider `default_tags` configuration block.

waitForCompletion.description: If enabled, the resource will wait for the Network Insights Analysis status to change to `succeeded` or `failed`. Setting this to `false` will skip the process. Default: `true`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering NetworkInsightsAnalysis resources.
